column4: hello room Question: i have 2 linux installations , 11.10 and 10.04 dual boot, how can i run programs/binaries  from 10.04 while being in 11.10 and vice versa
realistic answer is "don't"
thanks for reply, i just want to be able to "run" binaries from other installation
yes and the answer is "don't"
thanks but what can happen in worst case? or in normal case?
break things
i am prepared to take this risk,
then do it
it does not run
as I told you it won't
lol did any1  else tried it before if yes please guide me to some article , or maybe i am the only crazy one
no-one does this, because it's wrong
and as you've found, doesn't work
i thought with linux nothing is impossible :)
then you thought wrong. It's an OS the same as any other with rules and limitations
can you guide me to some article which suggest why won't it work or how binaries work ? or why can't binaries work standalone , for my better understanding
because they are built and linked against a different distro
pretty much the bottom line of it
you can't do that,
but if you wish to try, go for it
thanks :)
